original: Be careful around here.
string: 此处危险，多加小心。

original: I wonder about your timing sometimes, you know?
string: 你挑的这会儿，我有时真想不明白。

original: Unless it's urgent, might I suggest we get moving?
string: 若非十万火急，我建议我们还是尽快启程。

original: The waiting... the insufferable waiting.
string: 等待……折磨人的等待。

original: Please, stop wasting my time.
string: 够了，别再浪费我的时间。

original: This is so boring. Can't you finish up?
string: 无聊透顶，你就不能快些结束？

original: My uncle was always tinkering with stuff like you. I hated that man.
string: 我叔叔从前也总像你这样鼓捣东西，我最恨他了。

original: Hurry it up icebrain. I haven't got all day.
string: 快点，蠢货，我没工夫耗一整天。

original: Only a milkdrinker does that while threats are close by.
string: 唯有乳臭未干之辈，才会在强敌环伺时做这等事。

original: Look. I didn't join the Companions to wait around while you do that.
string: 听着，我加入战友团，可不是为了在这儿干等你做这些琐事。

original: Pfft. I don't have time for all that. Just give me heads to take off and I'm your man. But that? Nah, I'll leave all that to you.
string: 哼，我没空理会这些。只管把敌人脑袋送来让我砍，我便为你效命。至于这些？不必了，全交给你处理。

original: I'm the best warrior in Morthal - why would I need to mess about with things like you're doing?
string: 墨索尔最强的战士是我，我才不需要像你这样摆弄这些玩意。

original: Don't worry. Old Marcurio has got your back. But still, best hurry it up.
string: 别担心，老马库里奥为你殿后。不过，还是快些为妙。

original: Did you really hire me just so I could stand around watching you make stuff?
string: 你雇我来，就为了让我站在这儿看你做东西？

original: A mighty spellsword like me and you have me watching your back while you dabble in - whatever that is you're doing.
string: 像我这般强大的魔剑士，竟被你用来在你捣鼓这些——不管你在搞什么。

original: All that messing about like that is for milkdrinkers. Me? I prefer a good fight.
string: 摆弄这些琐事，只适合乳臭未干的小子。我？更喜欢一场痛快的战斗。

original: Go on, pretend you know what you're doing with that.
string: 继续吧，假装你很清楚自己在做什么。

original: That's one way to pass the time... I suppose.
string: 这也是一种打发时间的方式……我想。

original: Well if it keeps you busy, I'm not one to complain.
string: 既然能让你忙起来，我也不会抱怨。

original: Um? Are you sure that's supposed to come out like that?
string: 嗯？你确定那东西就该是这个样子？

original: What in the name of the gods are you doing?
string: 以神的名义，你究竟在做什么？

original: Best not spend too long fiddling with that. There might still be things that want to kill us hanging about.
string: 最好别在那上面磨蹭太久，说不定还有什么东西正等着要我们命呢。

original: You know the Falmer can probably hear all your fumbling, don't you?
string: 你知道吗，那些伐莫大概能听见你所有的笨拙响动。

original: Shall I ask our enemies to wait politely?
string: 要我去请我们的敌人礼貌地等等吗？

original: I will wait while you do that, but I doubt our enemies will do the same.
string: 我会等你做完，但我怀疑敌人可不会如此。

original: I suppose I'm expected to stand guard, as usual?
string: 我猜，照常，我得负责警戒吧？

original: Let's hope you don't wake up any more Draugr then eh?
string: 希望你别再把更多尸鬼吵醒了，嗯？

original: Must you always be messing about with things?
string: 你就非得一直鼓捣这些东西不可吗？

original: I tire of your constant tinkering with whatever you come across.
string: 你总是摆弄碰到的每样东西，我早已厌倦。

original: You just can't help yourself, can you?
string: 你就是管不住自己，对吧？

original: My patron, will we be moving out soon?
string: 我的主人，我们很快就要启程了吗？

original: You don't pay me to stand around watching you make things.
string: 我可不是光拿钱看你做东西的。

original: I see you're pretty handy with practical work, just like me.
string: 我看你干起活来挺在行的，跟我一样。

original: I hope you're not expecting me to carry whatever it is you're making there.
string: 希望你别指望我来搬你做的那堆东西吧。

original: I'll keep watch, but we should be quick.
string: 我会警戒，但我们得快些。

original: Best to keep your mind on the fight don't you think?
string: 最好把心思放在战斗上，你不觉得吗？

original: We might want to save that for later.
string: 或许我们该留到以后再做。

original: I'd prefer to deal with the threats first.
string: 我宁愿先解决眼前的威胁。

original: Oh, you're doing that. Again.
string: 哦，你又在弄这个了。又来了。

original: Well you sure like to keep busy, that's for sure.
string: 你确实喜欢让自己忙个不停，这没错。

original: Never thought I'd travel with someone so handy.
string: 从没想过我会和一个如此能干的人同行。

original: Is now really the best time for this?
string: 现在真是做这个的最佳时机吗？

original: Let's wait until we're somewhere safe.
string: 等我们到了安全的地方再说吧。

original: You know I get bored when you're doing that. Let's hurry it up.
string: 你知道我一看到你做这个就无聊。快点吧。

original: You're doing it again? Can't we just go kill stuff?
string: 你又来了？我们不能直接去砍点东西吗？

original: Funny, I always thought your hands were made for killing, not crafting.
string: 有趣，我一直以为你的手生来就是杀戮的，不是用来做这些的。

original: Aye, make what you need. Better to rely on yourself than some shopkeeper.
string: 好，做你需要的吧。靠自己总比靠商人靠谱。

original: Don't be too long with that. I'm eager to get going.
string: 别弄太久，我急着出发。

original: Hurry, we've no time to dawdle over trinkets.
string: 快，没时间在这些小玩意上磨蹭。

original: Surely that can wait until we're somewhere a bit safer?
string: 这肯定能等到我们到更安全的地方再做吧？

original: Do what you must, but don't forget there might still be enemies about.
string: 做你该做的，但别忘了周围可能还有敌人。

original: We should keep moving. What you're doing won't help if we get overrun.
string: 我们得继续前进。要是被敌人包围，你做的这些可帮不上忙。

original: You make, you mend, you fight. Such versatility.
string: 你会制造，会修理，会战斗。真是多才多艺。

original: All that skill... and all mine to watch. How lucky am I?
string: 如此精湛的技艺……全归我欣赏。我可真是幸运。

original: Crafting, killing... you do it all with such flair.
string: 制造，杀戮……你样样都做得如此出色。

original: You concentrate on what you're doing, I don't mind waiting.
string: 你专心做你的事，我不介意等。

original: Work quickly. Beauty loses its shine when we're bleeding out.
string: 快些动手。当我们血流不止时，再美的事物也失去了光彩。

original: By all means focus on your craft. But be mindful of what's lurking in the shadows.
string: 尽管专注于你的手艺吧。但别忘了暗处潜藏的东西。

original: Hmm. I like watching you do that. Even if it does get us killed.
string: 嗯，我喜欢看你做这个。哪怕这会让我们送命。

original: You're so good at this stuff. It's like you can do anything you put your mind to.
string: 你做这些事太在行了。仿佛你下定决心就没有办不到的。

original: I could probably watch you do that all day, but maybe we should get moving soon?
string: 我大概能看你做上一整天，但我们是不是该尽快出发了？

original: Whatever it is you're doing, I'm sure it will be good once you've finished.
string: 不管你在做什么，我相信完成之后一定会很好。

original: Oh? You're making something again?
string: 哦？你又在制作东西了？

original: We should probably get going before something bad happens.
string: 我们最好在出事前赶紧离开。

original: I'm not sure how you can concentrate on that, given where we are? Please hurry.
string: 我不明白在这种地方你怎么还能专心做这个？请快些。

original: Could you be quick? I don't want to be caught off guard!
string: 能快点吗？我不想措手不及！

original: Come on, hurry up.
string: 拜托，快点啊。

original: Come on, you need your hands free.
string: 快，你得把绑着手的绳子弄掉。

original: Um, do you think that's a good idea?
string: 呃，你觉得这主意好吗？

original: Really? Can't you wait until we're out of danger?
string: 真的吗？你就不能等到脱离危险再做？

original: I'm not sure this is a good place to be doing that.
string: 我不觉得这是做这事的好地方。

original: What are we waiting for?
string: 我们还在等什么？

original: I'm sick of waiting. When are we going to see some action?
string: 我不想等了。我们什么时候能看到一些动静？

original: You know I get bored easily, right?
string: 你知道我很容易无聊的，对吧？

original: Whatever it is you're doing there, you make it look effortless.
string: 不管你在那里做什么，你都显得毫不费力。

original: Looks like you've got a real talent for that.
string: 看来你确实有这方面的天赋。

original: Are you going to be much longer?
string: 你还要做多久？

original: Do you really have to be doing that now? Can it not wait?
string: 你非得现在做这个吗？就不能等会儿？

original: Do that if you must. But keep yourself ready for attack.
string: 你要做就做吧。但得随时准备应对攻击。

original: Best not to stay too long on that. We're vulnerable here.
string: 最好不要在这上面耽搁太久。我们在这里很脆弱。

original: Aye, better to make your own stuff than buy it. Or beg for it.
string: 是啊，自己制作总比去买，或者去乞讨强。

original: Don't make me wait around all day will you?
string: 别让我一整天都干等着，好吗？

original: Fancy yourself a real handyman, eh?
string: 自认是个真正的能工巧匠，是吧？

original: Got to admit, you're a woman that loves to craft, eh?
string: 得承认，你是个热爱制作的女人，是吧？

original: This ain't the time for that. Unless you're looking to die over whatever it is you're doing?
string: 现在不是做这个的时候。除非你想为手里的活计送命？

original: Work faster. I don't think we're alone here.
string: 快点。我觉得这里不止我们。

original: Keep your wits about you. I thought I heard movement.
string: 保持警惕。我好像听见了动静。

original: Work faster, before we get surrounded.
string: 快点，趁我们还没被包围。

original: That's not going to save us if we're dead you know?
string: 要是我们死了，这可救不了我们，你知道吗？

original: Yeah yeah. You do that. I'll wait around twiddling my thumbs. I get it.
string: 行行行，你忙你的。我就在这儿闲着没事干。我懂。

original: Sometimes I think you do that just to avoid fighting.
string: 有时候我觉得你做这个只是为了逃避战斗。

original: I'll just wait here, but please, don't spend all day at it.
string: 我就在这儿等，但求你，别花一整天。

original: If I had a Septim for every time you stopped to do that, I'd be a rich man.
string: 每次你停下来做这个，我都存一枚塞普汀，那我早就是个富翁了。

original: Whatever is trying to kill us isn't interested in your little project there, you know?
string: 你想做的那点小项目，可不会让想要杀我们的东西感兴趣，你知道吗？

original: Heh... that reminds me of... uh, something? Can't remember.
string: 呵……这让我想起……呃，某件事？记不清了。

original: Don't let me stop you. I'll just be... right here.
string: 别管我，我就在这儿……等着。

original: While you're doin' that, I'll do what I do best. Got any ale or mead?
string: 你忙你的，我去做我最拿手的事。有麦酒或蜜酒吗？

original: Come on now, put that down. We need to get out of here.
string: 行了，放下那个。我们得离开这儿。

original: Um - are you daft?
string: 呃——你疯了吗？

original: I don't mind waiting, but I'm not sure about, ya know? Them?
string: 我不介意等，但我不确定，你知道的？他们？

original: Preparation is as important as skill in battle.
string: 准备在战斗中与技巧同等重要。

original: Oh. I'll just wait over here then, shall I?
string: 哦。那我就在这儿等着，是吧？

original: I guess I'll just go read a book or something, then?
string: 我猜我还是去读本书什么的吧？

original: Right. You dabble with your thing, and I'll just go do something else then. But don't be long.
string: 行吧。你摆弄你的东西，我去干点别的。但别太久。

original: We should move. This isn't a safe place to work.
string: 我们该走了。这里不适合工作。

original: Um. Not the best time to be crafting.
string: 呃。现在不是制作的好时机。

original: I'll just stand around then shall I?
string: 那我就这么站着，是吧？

original: Making something useful there, I hope?
string: 希望你做的东西有点用处吧？

original: I suppose making or improving your own stuff is better than paying someone else to do it.
string: 自己动手制作或改进装备，总比花钱请人做要好。

original: Work quickly, or not at all. Danger is close.
string: 快点，不然就别做。危险就在附近。

original: Keep your focus on your surroundings, not on that.
string: 注意周围环境，别只盯着那个。

original: Best be quick with that. Danger's not far, I feel.
string: 最好快点做完。我感觉危险不远。

original: Might be wise to save that for later. We have company about.
string: 或许留到以后更明智。我们附近有家伙在。

original: Khajiit sometimes thinks you like to play more than you like to fight, yes?
string: 虎人有时觉得你更爱玩闹，而不是战斗，是吧？

original: Is it really necessary to be doing that, all the time?
string: 你就非得一直做这个不可吗？

original: This one's whiskers are twitching. Something comes, perhaps?
string: 这位的胡须在颤动。也许有东西来了？

original: This one idly wonders if this task would best be done at a time when we're not in enemy territory?
string: 这位只是好奇，这项任务是否该在非敌境时完成？

original: Really? You're doing that, now?
string: 真的吗？你现在就要做这个？

original: Khajiit thinks that you have lost your mind and would be better to wait before finishing that task.
string: 虎人觉得你疯了，最好等会儿再完成那任务。

original: Good. Every bit of work makes us stronger.
string: 好。每一点努力都让我们更强。

original: Orcs respect someone that works with their hands, like you.
string: 兽人敬重像你这样亲自动手的人。

original: I'll stand guard while you do that.
string: 你做你的，我来警戒。

original: Keep your eyes open. Crafting can wait.
string: 睁大眼睛。制作可以等。

original: We should keep moving. Don't want to get caught like this.
string: 我们得继续前进。不想就这样被逮住。

original: Best be quick. Don't want trouble knocking on the door.
string: 最好快点。别等麻烦找上门。

original: Keep alert. We're not alone.
string: 保持警惕。我们并不孤单。

original: Wow, you're good at everything aren't you?
string: 哇，你样样都行，是吧？

original: I feel sure that whatever you're doing there will be useful at some point.
string: 我确信你做的东西迟早会有用。

original: Better not get caught off guard here.
string: 最好别在这儿措手不及。

original: Careful, eh? Feels like something's watching us.
string: 当心点，嗯？感觉有东西在盯着我们。

original: Don't you think that would be easier when we're not under threat?
string: 你不觉得在没有威胁时做这个更容易吗？

original: My father always used to say 'Enemies first, chores second.'
string: 我父亲常说：“先杀敌，后做事。”

original: Save that for when we're safe, eh?
string: 留到安全时再做，行吗？

original: I can't decide if you're doing something useful, or just wasting my time.
string: 我分不清你是在做有用的事，还是在浪费我的时间。

original: Oh right. I'll just wait around looking at the floor shall I?
string: 哦，对。那我就在这儿低头看地等着，是吧？

original: Crafting things has its uses, but must you always be doing it?
string: 制作东西是有用，但你就非得一直做吗？

original: Not sure what you're doing there. Not sure I care. But I grow bored.
string: 不知道你在搞什么。其实我也不关心。但我快无聊死了。

original: If you keep this up much longer, I can't be responsible for what happens.
string: 你再这样下去，出了事我可不负责。

original: You do know our enemies won't wait while you play artisan, don't you?
string: 你知道敌人不会等你玩工匠，对吧？

original: Best to keep your wits about you round here. Maybe do that later?
string: 在这儿最好保持清醒。也许留到以后做？

original: If the enemy catches you unawares, don't say I didn't warn you.
string: 敌人偷袭你时，别说我没提醒过你。

original: Finish that later, we might have company.
string: 晚点再做，我们可能有客人了。

original: Must you do that? I'm fed up with all the waiting.
string: 非得做这个吗？我受够了等待。

original: You have a real talent for making simple jobs look difficult.
string: 你真有本事，能把简单的事弄得看起来很难。

original: Making potions can be dangerous, best pay attention to what you're doing there.
string: 制作药剂很危险，最好专心点。

original: Be careful with that potion. You wouldn't want to - uh - turn yourself invisible, or something.
string: 当心那药剂。你总不想——呃——把自己变得隐形吧，或者别的什么。

original: Oh, good work you're doing. Even a skilled mage like me can always use more potions.
string: 哦，你干得不错。像我这样技艺高超的法师也总需要更多药剂。

original: J'zargo will gladly take any potions you are making there.
string: 扎格很乐意收下你做的任何药剂。

original: I'm not sure what you're doing there, but it smells kind of odd.
string: 我不确定你在做什么，但这味道有点怪。

original: Unless you're mixing up a potion to get us out of here, you should probably hurry it along.
string: 除非你在调配能带我们离开这里的药剂，否则最好快点。

original: Alchemy at a time like this? Are you trying to get us killed?
string: 这种时候炼药？你是想害死我们吗？

original: I really don't think mixing up your herbs is appropriate in this place.
string: 我真觉得在这种地方调配草药不合适。

original: Do you think making a few potions is going to help us here?
string: 你觉得做几瓶药剂就能帮上忙吗？

original: Ah, grinding flowers. Such heroics.
string: 啊，研磨花朵。真是英雄壮举。

original: Um - that smell? Are you sure it's intentional?
string: 呃——那味道？你确定是故意的吗？

original: If you poison yourself, I'm not carrying you, you know?
string: 要是你把自己毒倒了，我可不会背你，明白吗？

original: The difference between poison and potion is a steady hand.
string: 毒药与药剂的区别，就在于手是否稳。

original: Mmm... smells like the swamps of Deshaan.
string: 嗯……这味道，像德沙安沼泽。

original: Save the tinkering for when we're not being hunted.
string: 等没人追我们时再鼓捣这些吧。

original: Unless that's a potion to make us vanish, we should get moving.
string: 除非你在做隐身药水，否则我们该走了。

original: I'm not sure mixing up your weird concoctions is appropriate here? Or anywhere for that matter?
string: 我不确定在这儿调配你那些古怪玩意儿是否合适？或者根本就哪儿都不合适？

original: This isn't the time to brew potions.
string: 现在不是酿造药剂的时候。

original: I suppose we are in desperate need of another jar of green sludge.
string: 我猜我们确实急需另一罐绿色烂泥。

original: Potions are tools, not toys. Remember that.
string: 药剂是工具，不是玩具。记住了。

original: I'm not too big on alchemy, so make it quick.
string: 我对炼金术不怎么感兴趣，所以快点。

original: Whatever it is you're mixing up there, don't be too long.
string: 不管你在那里调配什么，别太久。

original: Messing about with flowers and weird stuff while there's a chance we could get attacked? Huh?
string: 有可能被袭击的时候，还摆弄花花草草和古怪东西？哼？

original: Hurry it along with your potion making, it's not exactly safe here.
string: 快点做你的药剂，这儿可不安全。

original: Heh, never thought I'd see such patience from you. Most would rather be swinging steel than grinding flowers.
string: 呵，从没想过你能这么有耐心。大多数人宁愿挥舞钢铁也不愿研磨花朵。

original: That smell's worse than a troll's armpit. Are you sure you've done it right?
string: 这味道比巨魔的腋窝还臭。你确定弄对了？

original: A potion's no use if you're dead before you can drink it.
string: 药剂再好，没喝之前就死了也没用。

original: Mix quick eh? I don't like you having your back turned, you're open to a sneak attack.
string: 快点调配，嗯？我不喜欢你背对着我，容易被偷袭。

original: Mmm... such delicate hands. Careful, or you'll end up with more poison than potion.
string: 嗯……如此灵巧的双手。当心点，别调出的毒药比药剂还多。

original: You don't look well. Mix yourself up a cure while you're there.
string: 你看起来不太舒服。趁你在那儿，给自己调个治疗药剂吧。

original: I do enjoy watching you work. All those little ingredients turning into something much more powerful.
string: 我很喜欢看你工作。那些微小的材料变成更强大的东西。

original: Brewing while we're being hunted? Dangerous... but I like it.
string: 被追杀时还酿造药剂？危险……但我喜欢。

original: If the enemy comes for us, I don't think throwing flowers at them will do much.
string: 敌人要是来了，我觉得朝他们扔花花草草可没什么用。

original: Wow! You really know what you're doing. I'd probably blow myself up!
string: 哇！你真懂行。我要是做，怕是会把自己炸飞！

original: That smells bad. I hope you're not planning on drinking that yourself?
string: 这味道真难闻。希望你没打算自己喝吧？

original: Maybe mix something quick... in case we need it right now!
string: 也许调个快的……万一我们马上就需要！

original: I'll keep watch while you make that. But please hurry, I suspect we're not alone.
string: 我帮你警戒。但请快点，我怀疑我们不是独自一人。

original: Surely you can mix your potions somewhere else?
string: 你肯定能在别的地方调配药剂吧？

original: Probably not the best alchemy table to use, don't you think?
string: 这恐怕不是最好的炼金台，你不觉得吗？

original: What are you brewing up there? It smells a bit... funny?
string: 你在上面煮什么？味道有点……奇怪？

original: Careful what you mix there. Don't want you blowing yourself up.
string: 小心你调配的东西。可别把自己炸了。

original: Ahh... the hiss of the potion, the sting of the fumes. Brings back memories of the marsh.
string: 啊……药剂的嘶嘶声，蒸汽的刺痛感。让我想起了沼泽地的回忆。

original: Strange, how much power hides in roots and leaves.
string: 奇怪，根茎与叶片中竟藏着如此多的力量。

original: Do not linger too long. Our enemies circle while you mix.
string: 别逗留太久。你调配时，敌人正围着我们打转。

original: Brewing potions while danger threatens? An odd choice, but I'll stay alert.
string: 危险迫近时还酿造药剂？奇怪的选择，但我会保持警惕。

original: Hmph! Bottles and powders. I'll stick to mead.
string: 哼！瓶子和粉末。我还是喝蜜酒吧。

original: Never thought much of potions, but they do the job I suppose.
string: 从没太把药剂当回事，不过它们确实有用。

original: This ain't the time for fiddlin' with flowers.
string: 现在不是摆弄花花草草的时候。

original: Potions won't matter much if we're gutted by what's after us.
string: 要是被追我们的东西开膛破肚，药剂也无济于事。

original: Never had the patience for that sort of thing. Looks useful, though.
string: 我从没耐心做这种事。不过看起来有用。

original: Looks like a lot of messing about, can't you just buy a potion instead?
string: 看起来就是瞎忙活，你就不能直接买瓶药剂吗？

original: Reminds me of home... though the mushrooms there were less forgiving.
string: 让我想起家乡……虽然那儿的蘑菇可没这么宽容。

original: Mix faster. I don't want to die over a handful of herbs.
string: 快点调配。我不想为了一把草药送命。

original: Potions are useful, but not if you're dead.
string: 药剂有用，但前提是你还活着。

original: Whatever you're mixing up there, if it doesn't kill me, I'll drink it!
string: 不管你在那里调配什么，只要不毒死我，我就喝！

original: What are you puttin' in those bottles? Mead? Wine? Ale? Oh, poison? Yeah, I bet it's poison.
string: 你在瓶子里放什么？蜜酒？葡萄酒？麦酒？哦，毒药？对，我打赌是毒药。

original: While you're playin' bartender there, the enemy could be preparing to, ya know? Ambush us?
string: 你在这儿当调酒师的时候，敌人可能正准备，你知道的？伏击我们？

original: Hurry it up, we ain't got time for mixing flowers and what-not.
string: 快点，我们没时间摆弄花花草草这些玩意儿。

original: You handle those ingredients well. Not everyone can.
string: 你处理这些材料很在行。不是谁都能做到的。

original: Amazing what you can get into those bottles with the right skill.
string: 有合适的技能，能把这么多东西装进瓶子，真了不起。

original: I don't think this is the safest place to be mixing potions.
string: 我觉得这儿不是调配药剂最安全的地方。

original: Mix that up faster. I think we're being watched.
string: 快点调配。我觉得有人在盯着我们。

original: Ah, the delicate art of alchemy. Not as simple as it looks, is it?
string: 啊，炼金术这门精妙的艺术。看起来可没那么简单，是吧？

original: A well made potion can tip the balance of any fight.
string: 一瓶好药剂能扭转任何战局。

original: Alchemy can be useful, but I don't think this is the time?
string: 炼金术是有用，但我觉得现在不是时候？

original: Quickly, now. We may be interrupted.
string: 快点。我们可能会被打断。

original: One wrong stir and 'poof'! No fur, no whiskers!
string: 搅拌错一下，“砰”！毛发和胡须都没了！

original: This one thinks your mixtures will serve us well. Or not. We will see.
string: 这位觉得你的调配会对我们有帮助。或者没有。我们拭目以待。

original: Perhaps not the best time to play with bottles, yes?
string: 也许现在不是玩瓶子的好时机，是吧？

original: This one smells more than herbs. Trouble is close.
string: 这位闻到的不只是草药。麻烦近了。

original: Orc hands aren't made for this work. Glad yours are.
string: 兽人的手不适合干这种活。幸好你的手可以。

original: Hmph. Never thought bottles could win a fight.
string: 哼。从没想过瓶子能打赢一场仗。

original: Not the time for herbs and powders.
string: 现在不是摆弄草药和粉末的时候。

original: Are you sure you should be mixing that up here?
string: 你确定在这儿调配合适吗？

original: Best keep one eye on your alchemy and one eye on the room.
string: 最好一只眼盯着炼金，一只眼盯着四周。

original: Whoa! That smells... strong. What's it do?
string: 哇！这味道……真冲。它有什么用？

original: Careful with that! Don't want to blow us both up.
string: 当心那个！可不想让我们俩一起炸飞。

original: I smell danger, and I don't just mean from your potions.
string: 我闻到了危险，而且不只是来自你的药剂。

original: You should hurry up with your experiments. Enemies might be sneaking up on us as we speak.
string: 你该快点完成实验了。敌人可能正在摸过来。

original: Brewing poisons or potions? Either way, someone's not going to enjoy it.
string: 在酿毒药还是药剂？不管哪种，总有人会不高兴。

original: Ah, alchemy. Turning weeds into something almost useful.
string: 啊，炼金术。把杂草变成几乎有用的东西。

original: Yes, yes, make your potions while enemies sharpen their blades.
string: 行行行，你做你的药剂吧，敌人正磨刀呢。

original: If you want to die mixing herbs, don't let me stop you.
string: 如果你想死在调配草药上，别拦着我。

original: Making something useful there, I hope?
string: 希望你做的东西有点用处吧？

original: Watch you don't get blisters doing that.
string: 当心别弄出水泡。

original: I'll keep watch then shall I? Wouldn't want someone... or something... to steal your creation.
string: 那我来警戒？可不想有人……或者什么东西……偷走你的作品。

original: Tanning hides, now? Really?
string: 现在就鞣制皮革？真的吗？

original: I hope you wash your hands after doing that?
string: 希望你做完后记得洗手？

original: Working with leather is not for me, but I can see the value.
string: 处理皮革不适合我，但我知道它的价值。

original: Playing around with dead animal skins? No thankyou.
string: 摆弄死动物的皮？不了，谢谢。

original: Looks like it's coming along nicely.
string: 看起来进展不错。

original: Oh? Crafting me something nice to wear? A woman can dream, eh?
string: 哦？给我做件漂亮衣服？女人总可以幻想一下，是吧？

original: That leather is taking shape nicely.
string: 那皮革成型得不错。

original: Animal skins are always better if you've killed the beast yourself, don't you think?
string: 动物皮毛如果出自自己猎杀的野兽，总会更好，你不觉得吗？

original: Hides and leather eh? Not glorious, but they keep the rain and cold out.
string: 皮革和毛皮？不光彩，但能挡雨御寒。

original: Always good to make use of what you kill. Waste is for milk-drinkers.
string: 善用猎物总是好的。浪费是乳臭未干之辈才做的事。

original: I'll admit, soft leather against the skin has a certain... appeal.
string: 我得承认，柔软的皮革贴着皮肤，有种特别的……吸引力。

original: That's a good use of spoils. Waste not, want not eh?
string: 这是对战利品的好利用。不浪费，才不缺，是吧？

original: Watching someone work with leather is always a pleasure.
string: 看人处理皮革总是种享受。

original: Turning hides into something useful. That's so clever.
string: 把兽皮变成有用的东西。真聪明。

original: Ah, good. A lot of weapons and armor need leather for straps, fittings, that kind of thing.
string: 啊，很好。很多武器和护甲需要装上皮带和小配件什么的。

original: Bit dangerous to be messing about with cloth here, isn't it?
string: 在这儿摆弄布料有点危险，不是吗？

original: Tanning hides while danger hunts us? Risky. Very risky.
string: 危险追着我们时还鞣制皮革？冒险。非常冒险。

original: The smell of that hide... somehow reminds me of home.
string: 那皮革的气味……不知怎的让我想起了家乡。

original: Yeah, make use of every kill. Waste is for weaklings.
string: 好好利用每一次猎杀。浪费是弱者的行径。

original: Not bad. That'll do the job alright.
string: 不错。足够应付了。

original: Stretching hides eh? Not very glamorous, but practical.
string: 在拉伸兽皮？不太光鲜，但很实用。

original: Leather's fine and all, but I prefer a good mug of mead.
string: 皮革不错，但比起这个，我更喜欢一大杯蜜酒。

original: Best wash your hands after doing that, you think? You know, messing with dead animals?
string: 做完那事后最好洗洗手，你觉得呢？毕竟在摆弄死动物。

original: Good use of what we've hunted. Best not to waste anything.
string: 好好利用了我们的猎物。最好什么都别浪费。

original: Making good use of your kills. Practical.
string: 充分利用了你的猎物。很务实。

original: Working with leather is simple, but practical. If not a bit... stinky?
string: 处理皮革很简单，也很实用。虽然有点……臭？

original: Stretching hides? Not as pretty as fur, but useful all the same.
string: 在拉伸兽皮？不如毛皮好看，但同样有用。

original: This one likes that nothing is wasted.
string: 这位喜欢物尽其用。

original: Not as strong as steel, but it works.
string: 不如钢铁坚固，但能用。

original: Hides turned to armor. Practical.
string: 兽皮变成护甲。实用。

original: Making use of the hides you picked up? Smart.
string: 在利用你捡到的兽皮？聪明。

original: Nothing goes to waste with you, does it?
string: 在你这儿，什么都浪费不了，是吧？

original: Messing with filthy dead animal skins? No thanks. Not for me.
string: 摆弄肮脏的死动物皮？不了，谢谢。不适合我。

original: You have talent. Keep working at your craft, and you'll be a fine smith one day.
string: 你天赋异禀，继续努力吧，肯定能成为一个优秀的铁匠。

original: Make sure you get that fire real hot. Smithing is not for the weak.
string: 确保炉火烧得够旺。锻造可不是软弱者能干的活。

original: Whatever you're making there, there's no chance it will be as good as my trusty Grimsever.
string: 不管你在那里做什么，都不可能比我的可靠伙伴无情切割者更好。

original: Make sure you give that piece a good finish.
string: 确保给那件东西好好收个尾。

original: If you're making me a weapon, I'll see it gets well used.
string: 如果你在给我做武器，我会好好用它。

original: You better be ready to use whatever it is you're making if the enemy finds us.
string: 敌人要是找到我们，你最好准备好使用你做的东西。

original: As much as I love the smell of hot steel, I don't think it's very clever to be doing it here.
string: 尽管我很喜欢烧热钢铁的气味，但我觉得在这儿做这个不太明智。

original: Careful with that tool. There are sparks everywhere.
string: 当心那个工具。到处都是火花。

original: I suppose we can't all be master craftsmen?
string: 我想我们不可能都是大师级工匠吧？

original: I hope you're making something decent for me to fight with. Either way, hurry it up.
string: 希望你给我做件像样的武器。不管怎样，快点。

original: I'm not sure this is a good place to be demonstrating your prowess.
string: 我不确定这是展示你技艺的好地方。

original: Truly? Hammering steel while danger closes in?
string: 真的吗？危险逼近时还在敲打钢铁？

original: You do realize our enemies can hear your noise ringing out for miles?
string: 你该明白，敌人能听到你的动静传出去好几里地吧？

original: In Morrowind, weapons were made to last generations.
string: 在晨风，武器是为传世而打造的。

original: That steel won't shape itself.
string: 那钢铁不会自己成型。

original: Strong metal makes for strong warriors.
string: 坚固的金属造就强大的战士。

original: Working with metal again I see?
string: 又在摆弄金属了，我看到了？

original: We should deal with the threat before you work that.
string: 你做那个之前，我们该先解决威胁。

original: Um - not the best time for blacksmithing.
string: 呃——现在不是锻造的好时机。

original: You might draw attention with all that noise.
string: 这么大的动静可能会引来注意。

original: That sound will carry a long way, finish what you're doing quickly.
string: 那声音传得很远，快点完成你的事。

original: Working with metal has a certain brutality to it.
string: 摆弄金属有种特有的粗犷。

original: Ah! The smells and sounds of good old fashioned hard work. Nothing better!
string: 啊！古老而辛勤劳动的气味与声响。没有比这更好的了！

original: A reliable weapon's worth more than any chest of gold.
string: 一件可靠的武器胜过任何一箱黄金。

original: Yeah, you keep hammering. I'll just wait here, shall I?
string: 行，你继续敲打。我就在这儿等着，是吧？

original: The ring of steel carries far. Careful who hears it.
string: 钢铁的撞击声传得很远。当心谁会听到。

original: We should move soon, before your racket draws the curious.
string: 我们该快点走，免得你的吵闹引来好奇的家伙。

original: Hard work, sweat and steel. Now that's appealing.
string: 辛勤的劳作、汗水与钢铁。这才叫吸引人。

original: Watching you work like that is always a pleasure.
string: 看你那样工作，总是种享受。

original: Every strike you make echoes, you know. Be careful not to attract unwelcome visitors.
string: 你每一击都会产生回响，知道吗？当心别引来不速之客。

original: Hush now, the sound will draw them straight to us.
string: 小声点，这声音会直接把他们引来。

original: Loud hammering while enemies might be nearby? Bold choice!
string: 敌人可能就在附近时大声敲打？大胆的选择！

original: If they didn't hear us before, they definitely do now!
string: 如果他们之前没听到，现在肯定听到了！

original: Wow! Sparks flying everywhere. It makes you look so... heroic!
string: 哇！火花四溅。让你看起来真……英雄！

original: No wonder your gear always looks so good.
string: 难怪你的装备总是这么好。

original: You must be pretty desperate to do that, given that we're in danger here.
string: 在这种危险境地还做这个，你一定是相当绝望了。

original: Why are you messing about smithing, here of all places?
string: 为什么偏偏在这儿鼓捣锻造？

original: Not bad. Reminds me when I first started smithing.
string: 不错嘛。让我想起我第一次打铁的情形。

original: I hope you're making something decent for me eh?
string: 希望你给我做件像样的东西，嗯？

original: The sounds of your work, somehow reminds me of the Hist sap bubbling.
string: 你工作的声音，不知怎的让我想起希斯特树液的沸腾声。

original: Strong arms, steady hammer. You have the makings of a great blacksmith.
string: 有力的手臂，稳定的锤击。你有成为伟大铁匠的潜质。

original: Your hammer sings too loud. Others may come to listen.
string: 你的锤子唱得太响。别人可能会来聆听。

original: You somehow imagine the enemy won't notice all the noise you're making?
string: 你该不会以为敌人听不到你弄出的动静吧？

original: I'm surprised you can even work that thing, with your blacksmithing skills.
string: 以你的锻造手艺，我惊讶你居然还能操作那东西。

original: You work that thing pretty well. For a milkdrinker.
string: 你操作那玩意儿还挺在行。对个乳臭未干之辈来说。

original: Making me some new gear there?
string: 在给我做新装备吗？

original: You'll be smithin' your own coffin if you don't get a move on.
string: 再不快点，你就要给自己打造棺材了。

original: All that hammerin' is bound to bring trouble our way.
string: 这么一通敲打，肯定会把麻烦引到我们这儿。

original: Looks like hard work, hopefully you know what you're doing.
string: 看起来挺费劲，希望你知道自己在做什么。

original: Last time I tried that I got a spark, right in my eye. Couldn't see right for days!
string: 上次我试的时候，火星溅进眼睛。好几天都看不清！

original: All that hammering is going to bring the enemy right to us.
string: 这么一通敲打会直接把敌人引来。

original: You think nobody will hear that? Shouldn't you wait 'til we're safe?
string: 你以为没人会听到？不该等安全了再做吗？

original: Say... you... you ever try making shoes? I did, once... think I lost 'em.
string: 说……你……你试过做鞋吗？我做过一次……好像弄丢了。

original: Hm? Oh, yeah... keep... hammering. You're doing great.
string: 嗯？哦，对……继续……敲打。你干得不错。

original: You know, I've got this terrible hammering sound in my head... oh wait! It's you!
string: 你知道吗，我脑子里有股可怕的敲打声……哦等等！是你！

original: Keep poundin' away at that, and maybe they'll come and kill us just to stop the noise.
string: 继续这么砸下去，说不定他们会来杀了我们，只为让这噪音停下。

original: Better get that done fast. I think I heard something.
string: 最好快点做完。我好像听见了什么。

original: You've got a blacksmith's touch. That's impressive work.
string: 你有铁匠的手艺。这活干得不错。

original: Huh? What's that supposed to be? I think you need more practice.
string: 哼？那玩意是什么？我觉得你得多练练。

original: The sound of hammering is strangely relaxing.
string: 敲打的声音不知为何让人放松。

original: Fool! The ringing of that hammer will draw attention.
string: 蠢货！那锤子的响声会引来注意。

original: Er, now may not be the best time for smithing.
string: 呃，现在可能不是锻造的最佳时机。

original: Loud hammering while foes lurk? Bold strategy.
string: 敌人潜伏时大声敲打？大胆的策略。

original: We'd best get moving before your clattering draws a crowd.
string: 最好在你叮当响引来一群人之前动身。

original: Working with metal is a worthwhile task.
string: 摆弄金属是件值得做的事。

original: What're you making there? Anything for me?
string: 你在那儿做什么？有我的份吗？

original: This one smells the fire and the iron.
string: 这位闻到了火与铁的气息。

original: Sparks dance like stars when you strike the metal.
string: 你敲击金属时，火花如星辰般舞动。

original: The ringing of your hammer will draw our foes, like moths to a flame.
string: 你锤子的响声会引来敌人，如同飞蛾扑火。

original: This one hears more than your hammering. Trouble is near, no?
string: 这位听到的不只是你的敲打声。麻烦近了，是吧？

original: Now that's work I can respect.
string: 这才是我能尊重的工作。

original: Every warrior should know their way around the forge.
string: 每个战士都应该懂得如何使用铁砧。

original: That hammer's ringing out too loud. They could hear it.
string: 那锤子响得太厉害。他们能听见。

original: We're not exactly safe here. You should leave that 'til later.
string: 这儿可不安全。你应该留到以后再做。

original: You'll draw every bandit for miles if you keep hammering like that.
string: 你再这么敲下去，方圆几里的强盗都会被引来。

original: Uh, hammering like that is bound to draw unwelcome attention.
string: 呃，这么敲肯定会引来不受欢迎的注意。

original: Not sure we've got time for your metalwork right now?
string: 不确定我们现在有时间做你的金属活？

original: Nice work. I find the sparks fascinating.
string: 干得不错。我觉得那些火花很迷人。

original: A good blacksmith will never be short of work. And clearly, you're not a good blacksmith.
string: 好铁匠从不缺活干。显然，你不是个好铁匠。

original: That's decent work, better than some of the blacksmiths I've seen.
string: 干得不错，比我见过的一些铁匠强。

original: What're you trying to do? Make your blade sharper than your wit? Yes... that won't take much effort.
string: 你想干嘛？让你的刀刃比你的头脑更锋利？嗯……那不需要多大努力。

original: Not the best time to craft a masterpiece.
string: 现在不是打造杰作的好时机。

original: All that hammering will call them straight to us.
string: 这么一通敲打会直接把他们叫来。

original: Something smells good. But I bet the Draugr can smell it too.
string: 闻起来不错。但我打赌尸鬼也能闻到。

original: That smells good. Almost like authentic Hammerfell cuisine.
string: 闻起来不错。几乎像正宗的落锤料理。

original: That smells nice. Hope it's what I like. You know what I like by now, surely?
string: 闻起来很香。希望是我喜欢的。你应该知道我喜欢什么了吧？

original: Whatever you're making there, I bet it's not as good as old Tilma makes us.
string: 不管你在那里做什么，我敢说肯定不如老提尔玛给我们做的。

original: J'zargo will smell enemies coming while you cook. Unless J'zargo gets the smells confused.
string: 你在做饭时，扎格会闻到敌人靠近。除非扎格把气味搞混了。

original: Something smells foul... be ready to fight - uh - what? Oh - it's just your cooking.
string: 有股难闻的气味……准备战斗——呃——什么？哦——只是你在做饭。

original: Not sure why you're cooking here, but I don't like the idea.
string: 不清楚你为什么在这儿做饭，但我不喜欢这个主意。

original: Ah! That fresh cooked smell. Reminds me of better days.
string: 啊！那新鲜出炉的香味。让我想起了好日子。

original: No idea what that's supposed to be, but I think I lost my appetite.
string: 不知道那玩意是个什么东西，但我觉得我胃口没了。

original: Let me guess - you're making just enough for yourself?
string: 让我猜猜——你只够做自己吃的吧？

original: I'm surprised. That smells almost edible!
string: 我挺意外。那闻起来几乎能吃！

original: Typical of you. Thinking of your stomach with danger all around us.
string: 典型的你。周围都是危险，还想着你的胃。

original: I hope making yourself a snack is worth risking our lives for?
string: 希望你做点心值得拿我们的命去冒险？

original: Season it well. Even travel rations deserve flavor.
string: 调味重些。连行军口粮也该有滋味。

original: Back home, we used saltrice and kwama eggs. You'd like it.
string: 在家乡，我们用盐米和库阿玛蛋。你会喜欢的。

original: Do you think the enemy will wait for us to eat?
string: 你觉得敌人会等我们吃完饭吗？

original: Unless you're boiling some oil to throw at the enemy, this can wait, can't it?
string: 除非你在煮油准备泼敌人，不然这事能等，对吧？

original: Are you trying to lure our enemies in with the smell?
string: 你是想用气味把敌人引过来吗？

original: Perhaps we should eat after the danger has passed.
string: 也许等危险过去后再吃？

original: A warm meal is worth more than gold on a cold night.
string: 寒冷的夜晚，一顿热饭胜过黄金。

original: The trick is knowing when to stop before it burns.
string: 关键是知道什么时候该停，免得烧焦。

original: That smells decent. Better than I expected actually.
string: 闻起来还行。实际上比我预期的好。

original: If you're cooking meat for me, make it extra bloody.
string: 如果你在给我做肉，做得血些。

original: Now? You're cooking now?
string: 现在？你现在做饭？

original: A warm meal won't help if we're dead.
string: 如果我们死了，热饭也没用。

original: Cookin', fightin', drinkin'... aye, that's how a Nord lives.
string: 做饭、战斗、喝酒……对，诺德人就这么活着。

original: Hope you're making enough for me there.
string: 希望你做的够我吃。

original: I'll admit, that does smell pretty good.
string: 我得承认，那闻起来确实不错。

original: You keep cooking. I'll take care of whatever comes sniffing after the smell.
string: 你继续做饭。谁闻味找来，我来对付。

original: This hardly seems the time to be thinking about food, you think?
string: 现在似乎不是考虑食物的时候，你觉得呢？

original: A good meal keeps the sword arm steady.
string: 一顿好饭能让持剑的手更稳。

original: Whatever that is, it smells wonderful.
string: 不管那是什么，闻起来真香。

original: Cooking? Now? I do hope our enemies enjoy the smell.
string: 做饭？现在？我真希望我们的敌人也喜欢这气味。

original: Now's not the time for cooking.
string: 现在不是做饭的时候。

original: Mmm! That smells great. Is it ready yet?
string: 嗯！闻起来很棒。好了吗？

original: Don't burn it this time, eh?
string: 这次别烧焦了，行吗？

original: Um? I'm not sure the enemy will wait for us to finish eating.
string: 呃？我不确定敌人会等我们吃完。

original: I'll try to keep watch. You just concentrate on not ruining the food, okay?
string: 我尽量警戒。你专心别把食物搞砸，行吗？

original: Hmm? I'm not sure this is a great time to be thinking about your belly?
string: 嗯？我不确定现在是考虑你肚子的好时机？

original: Are you daft? The smell and noise will attract enemies and bring them in on us?
string: 你疯了吗？这气味和动静会引来敌人，让他们扑向我们？

original: Mmm! What is that? It's making my stomach rumble!
string: 嗯！那是什么？让我肚子咕咕叫了！

original: Something smells nice. Don't forget the salt.
string: 有股香味。别忘了盐。

original: Heh... What are you making, I wonder?
string: 嘿……你在做什么，我好奇呢？

original: A good meal warms the body for the battles ahead.
string: 一顿好饭能为接下来的战斗暖身。

original: The scent will draw more than friends. Finish quickly.
string: 这气味会引来的不只是朋友。快点做完。

original: Hmph. What use is a full belly if you're dead?
string: 哼。如果你死了，吃饱了有什么用？

original: That smells better than half the slop they serve in Skyrim's inns.
string: 闻起来比天际省酒馆里一半的泔水都好。

original: Make sure you make enough for everyone, eh?
string: 确保给每个人都做够了，行吗？

original: You planning your next meal while we're being hunted?
string: 我们正被追杀时，你就在计划下一顿饭？

original: Don't you think the smell will attract unwelcome attention?
string: 你不觉得这气味会引来不速之客吗？

original: That smells better than most of what I ate in Morrowind.
string: 闻起来比我当年在晨风吃的大多数东西都好。

original: Can't fight on an empty stomach, eh? That'll help. If it's any good.
string: 空着肚子打不了仗，是吧？那会有用。如果味道还行的话。

original: Perhaps leave the cooking until we're not surrounded by enemies?
string: 也许等我们没被敌人包围时再做饭？

original: Smells nice, but it'll bring more than friends if we're not careful.
string: 闻起来不错，但若不小心，引来的可不只是朋友。

original: Hmm... smells kinda... like my boots. Not bad, just... you know.
string: 嗯……闻起来有点……像我的靴子。不算差，就是……你知道的。

original: Uh... you making stew, or... something else?
string: 呃……你在做炖菜，还是……别的什么？

original: Mind if I have a taste? Ya know, just to test it?
string: 我尝一口行吗？就是，检验一下。

original: You might wanna hurry it up, or we might end up as supper.
string: 你最好快点，否则我们可能变成别人的晚餐。

original: Look, I'm always looking for a free meal, but I'm not sure now is the time?
string: 听着，我总想找顿免费饭，但我不确定现在是时候。

original: A freshly cooked meal will help keep your strength up.
string: 一顿新鲜做好的饭能帮你保持体力。

original: That smells pretty good. Hope you're making enough for me.
string: 闻起来相当不错。希望你做的够我吃。

original: This hardly feels like the right time to cook.
string: 现在感觉不太适合做饭。

original: That smell will stir up more than our appetites if you're not careful.
string: 你若不小心，这气味激起的可不只是我们的食欲。

original: Mmm that smells delightful. Better than a lot of inns, I'd wager.
string: 嗯，闻起来真香。我敢说比很多酒馆的都好。

original: Can't beat a nice meal you've cooked yourself, eh?
string: 自己做的美味饭食，没什么能比得上，是吧？

original: Not sure a hot meal is worth dying for.
string: 不确定一顿热饭值得为此送命。

original: If you're not careful, we might end up on the menu.
string: 若不小心，我们可能会上别人的菜单。

original: I'm thinking that cooking here is not the best idea.
string: 我觉得在这儿做饭不是个好主意。

original: Khajiit's belly rumbles already. What is it that you are making?
string: 扎格肚子已经咕咕叫了。你在做什么？

original: A good meal makes for good travel.
string: 一顿好饭能让旅途顺利。

original: Perhaps cooking can wait, yes? Or I fear we may soon be the meal.
string: 也许做饭能等等，是吧？不然我担心我们很快会成为别人的饭菜。

original: The scent is nice. But this one thinks it will attract the wrong kind of interest, no?
string: 气味不错。但这位觉得会引来不该来的注意，是吧？

original: Food. Simple, strong, keeps you on your feet.
string: 食物。简单，实在，能让你站稳脚跟。

original: Better than chewing dried meat. I hope.
string: 总比嚼干肉强。希望如此。

original: Whatever you're cooking, it won't matter if we're dead.
string: 不管你做什么，如果我们死了，那就毫无意义。

original: Well, it smells good, but I'd rather not wait around to eat it.
string: 嗯，闻起来不错，但我不愿在这儿等着吃。

original: Even heroes like you need a hot meal sometimes, right?
string: 像你这样的英雄有时也需要一顿热饭，对吧？

original: Mmm! Smells great. What are we having?
string: 嗯！闻起来很棒。我们吃什么？

original: Oh, are you cooking us some breakfast?
string: 哦，你在给我们做早餐吗？

original: Rustling up some lunch there I take it?
string: 在张罗午饭吧，我猜？

original: Making some dinner? I hope you're doing enough for me too.
string: 在做晚饭？希望你也给我做一份。

original: That smells great. What's for supper?
string: 闻起来很棒。晚饭是什么？

original: Are you sure cooking, right here, is the best idea?
string: 你确定在这儿做饭是最佳选择？

original: Uh - I think the food will keep? We need to get out of here. Now.
string: 呃——我觉得食物能放？我们得离开这儿。现在。

original: Hmm. Let's hope that tastes better than it looks.
string: 嗯。希望味道比看起来好。

original: Really? You're cooking where we might get killed. Or worse. Smart choice.
string: 真的吗？在可能被杀或更糟的地方做饭。明智的选择。

original: I don't think you should be messing with that enchanting stuff here.
string: 我觉得你不该在这儿鼓捣附魔的东西。

original: Enchanting with soul gems is something we were taught at the college quite early.
string: 用灵魂石附魔是学院里很早教的内容。

original: You might think you're clever doing that, but I don't agree. Not here, anyway.
string: 你可能觉得自己这么做很聪明，但我不同意。至少现在不行。

original: Enchanting is no substitute for good old fashioned steel. Or so I've heard.
string: 附魔无法替代传统的钢铁。我是这么听说的。

original: Careful! That glow isn't always friendly.
string: 当心！那光芒未必总是友善的。

original: Try not to blow yourself up, eh?
string: 尽量别把自己炸了，行吗？

original: All this messing about with soul gems. Leave all that well alone, I say.
string: 尽在这儿摆弄灵魂石。我说，别碰那些东西。

original: I know enchanting can be useful, but do you have to do it right now?
string: 我知道附魔有用，但非得现在做吗？

original: Look I know you want to improve your gear, but doing it here is a little bit, uh, unwise, let's say?
string: 听着，我知道你想升级装备，但在这儿做，有点……呃，不太明智，这么说吧？

original: Perhaps we can focus on surviving before enchanting souvenirs?
string: 也许我们该先专注活命，再考虑附魔当纪念品？

original: A bit risky to open your mind to magic right now, isn't it?
string: 现在就向魔法敞开思维，有点冒险，不是吗？

original: Dunmer craftsmen wove soul and steel together for war.
string: 丹莫工匠曾将灵魂与钢铁编织，用于战争。

original: Can't you play with your soul gems when we're not so exposed?
string: 等我们不这么暴露时，你再玩你的灵魂石不行吗？

original: Too dangerous to enchant right now.
string: 现在附魔太危险了。

original: I'll stand guard, but don't take too long.
string: 我来警戒，但别花太久时间。

original: I'll be honest, messing with souls makes me feel a bit... uneasy.
string: 说实话，摆弄灵魂让我感觉有点……不安。

original: Enchanting has its place in the world, but that doesn't mean I have to like it.
string: 附魔在世界上有它的位置，但这不代表我必须喜欢它。

original: Enchanting here? Might as well just paint a target on your back.
string: 在这儿附魔？不如直接在背上画个靶子。

original: So you expect me to keep watch while you fumble with soul gems?
string: 所以你指望我警戒，而你在这儿笨手笨脚地摆弄灵魂石？

original: Careful. Treat them with respect. Some souls do not like to be chained.
string: 当心。要尊重它们。有些灵魂不喜欢被束缚。

original: If you blow us up, I won't be laughing.
string: 如果你把我们炸了，我可不会笑。

original: I wonder what poor soul died to make your tinkering possible, eh?
string: 我在想，是什么可怜的灵魂死去，才让你的摆弄成为可能，嗯？

original: Whatever it is you're enchanting, make it quick. I grow bored.
string: 不管你附魔什么，快点。我快无聊死了。

original: Be quick about it, I swear I hear footsteps.
string: 快点做完，我发誓我听见脚步声了。

original: You dabble in that while danger stirs? Are you bold, or just stupid?
string: 危险潜伏时你还玩这个？你是勇敢，还是愚蠢？

original: Weaving souls into objects is a dangerous game, friend.
string: 将灵魂编织进物品是场危险的游戏，朋友。

original: Not sure I entirely approve of what you're doing. But it's really not my place to say.
string: 我不确定是否完全赞同你的做法。但这不该由我来说。

original: Dabbling with magicka with enemies present? Sometimes, I wonder about you.
string: 敌人在场时还玩魔法？有时，我真搞不懂你。

original: I'd recommend you leave the enchanting until we're in safer surroundings.
string: 我建议你等到了更安全的地方再附魔。

original: Ooooh, that glow is amazing! Can you show me how to do that sometime?
string: 哦哦哦，那光芒真棒！改天能教我怎么做吗？

original: What you're doing just feels wrong. But also, I don't know... exciting?
string: 你做的事感觉就是不对。但又说不清……有点刺激？

original: Uh - maybe you should enchant that faster. I swear I heard... something?
string: 呃——也许你该快点附魔。我发誓我听见了……什么？

original: I'm sure what you're doing there is useful, but maybe save it for when we're not about to be attacked?
string: 我肯定你做的事有用，但能不能留到我们没快被攻击时再做？

original: I hope what you're doing is important enough to help us in a fight.
string: 希望你做的事重要到能在战斗中帮上忙。

original: Enchanting? Really? At a time like this? Pfft!
string: 附魔？真的吗？在这种时候？哼！

original: Enchanting your gear can be useful in a fight, I'll admit.
string: 我承认，给装备附魔在战斗中可能有用。

original: I wonder what poor creature died to fill your soul gems?
string: 我在想，是什么可怜的生物死去，才填满了你的灵魂石？

original: The hum of the soul gem... it almost sounds... alive.
string: 灵魂石的嗡鸣……听起来几乎……像活着。

original: Some call what you're doing art. Others think it cruel. Or even... never mind.
string: 有人称你做的事是艺术。有人觉得残忍。甚至……算了。

original: Enchant if you must. But be ready to spring into action given where we are.
string: 如果你非得附魔就做吧。但考虑到我们所在的位置，得随时准备行动。

original: You know enemies won't just wait around while you weave magicka, right?
string: 你知道敌人不会等你施完法再动手，对吧？

original: Heh. Just don't fry your own hands.
string: 嘿。别把自己的手烤焦了。

original: That glow makes me a bit uneasy.
string: 那光芒让我有点不安。

original: Not sure enchanting will do us much good if we're attacked with our backs turned.
string: 如果我们在转身时被攻击，我不确定附魔有多大用。

original: Using souls like that is a bit... creepy. Even more so when we're at risk of being attacked.
string: 那样使用灵魂有点……诡异。尤其在我们可能被攻击时更甚。

original: That strange hum of trapped power. Soothing, in a way.
string: 那股被禁锢力量的奇异嗡鸣。某种程度上，还挺抚慰人心。

original: I really don't know how you do that... looks tricky.
string: 我真不知道你怎么做到的……看起来挺难。

original: Spare us the light show. Our foes won't admire it.
string: 省省你的灯光秀吧。我们的敌人可不会欣赏。

original: Enchant that thing faster. I feel we're not alone here.
string: 快点给那东西附魔。我感觉我们不是独自一人。

original: That glow's making me dizzy. Or... I dunno... maybe I'm just dizzy.
string: 那光芒让我头晕。或者……我不知道……也许我只是头晕了。

original: Enchant that thing for much longer and I might just sober up.
string: 再给那东西附魔久一点，我可能就清醒了。

original: You know someone once told me, men don't 'have' souls. They are souls!
string: 你知道吗，有人曾告诉我，人不是拥有灵魂，他们本身就是灵魂！

original: If we wait here much longer, we'll be the ones inside those soul gems. Just sayin'.
string: 如果我们再等久一点，我们就会被装进那些灵魂石里了。说真的。

original: Stuffing souls into stuff here? Of all places? Here?
string: 在这儿，把灵魂塞进东西里？偏偏选这个地方？这儿？

original: Whoever thought of using soul gems to enchant things must have been a genius.
string: 想到用灵魂石来附魔的人一定是个天才。

original: Enchanting is a skill like any other, and it could save your life.
string: 附魔和其他技能一样，或许能救你的命。

original: Watch out. The glow from the enchanter might give us away.
string: 当心。附魔台的光芒可能会暴露我们。

original: I thought I heard something. Best save the enchanting for later.
string: 我好像听见了什么。最好把附魔留到以后。

original: You make that look effortless. Impressive.
string: 你做得看起来毫不费力。真厉害。

original: Ah, the hum of magicka. Quite mesmerising, isn't it?
string: 啊，魔法的嗡鸣。相当迷人，不是吗？

original: That glow is quite lovely, but I fear it might give us away.
string: 那光芒很漂亮，但我担心会暴露我们。

original: Might be best to leave the enchanting for a safer spot.
string: 也许最好把附魔留到更安全的地方。

original: This one sees the light dance around your hands.
string: 这位看见光芒在你手中舞动。

original: Soul gems are tricky, like the desert winds.
string: 灵魂石很棘手，如同沙漠的风。

original: Enchant later, fight now, yes?
string: 以后再附魔，现在先战斗，好吗？

original: The pretty lights will draw eyes we do not want.
string: 那些漂亮的光会引来不想要的目光。

original: Hmph. I'm not really impressed by all that soul gem stuff.
string: 哼。我对那些灵魂石的把戏并不怎么感兴趣。

original: That kind of thing is best left well alone if you ask me.
string: 依我看，那种东西最好别碰。

original: That glow will draw trouble.
string: 那光芒会引来麻烦。

original: We're not safe here. Put the gem away.
string: 这儿不安全。把灵魂石收起来。

original: I could watch this all day. Feels like real power.
string: 我能看一整天。感觉像是真正的力量。

original: That glow is amazing. It's making me sleepy.
string: 那光芒真奇妙。让我有点犯困。

original: Uh, maybe we should wait? Surely that light's gonna draw attention.
string: 呃，也许我们该等等？那光肯定会引来注意。

original: I thought I heard something. Maybe do your enchanting in a bit?
string: 我好像听见了什么。也许稍后再附魔？

original: More glowing trinkets. Just what the world needs.
string: 又多一个发光的小玩意。世界就缺这个。

original: You picked a fine time to tinker with your soul gems. Brilliant! Just... brilliant.
string: 你挑了个好时候摆弄灵魂石。真棒！真是……太棒了。

original: Improving a staff is well worth it, if that's your kind of thing.
string: 升级法杖很值得，如果你喜欢的话。

original: You know, this should make the house more unique.
string: 你知道，这应该能让房子更独特。

original: You swing that axe pretty well, got to admit.
string: 你挥那把斧头挺在行，我得承认。

original: Oh you can't beat the smell of fresh baked goods.
string: 哦，新鲜烘焙的食物气味是无可替代的。

original: Mind yourself on that. It's hot you know.
string: 当心点。那东西很烫，你知道的。

original: Cutting wood all day isn't going to get much done now, is it?
string: 整天砍木头也干不了多少事，对吧？

original: Careful not to burn yourself, you know what you're like.
string: 当心别烧着自己，你什么样子你自己清楚。

original: Don't burn your fingers, we've got a long road ahead.
string: 别烧了手指，我们还有很长的路要走。

original: Baking? How very... domestic of you.
string: 在烤东西？真够……居家的你啊。

original: I'll just wait here while you're polishing up your staff, shall I?
string: 我就在这儿等你把法杖擦亮，好吗？

original: Be careful around that. It gets so hot, you might burn yourself.
string: 当心那东西。太烫了，可能会烧伤你。

original: Watch those fingers! It looks hot.
string: 当心手指！看起来很烫。

original: Mmm, I can't wait to taste that. It smells lovely already.
string: 嗯，我等不及要尝尝了。闻起来已经很香了。

original: I hope you're baking enough for two!
string: 希望你做的够两个人吃！

original: I'm sure this new addition to your house will be lovely.
string: 我肯定你房子的新添置会很美好。

original: Nice swing! You could split a tree in half with that!
string: 好挥击！你都能把树劈成两半了！

original: Chopping wood is simple, but necessary.
string: 砍木头很简单，但很有必要。

original: Mind the heat there, wouldn't want to burn yourself.
string: 注意那里的高温，可不想你烧伤自己。

original: Careful, burnt fingers won't win any battles.
string: 当心，烧伤的手指可赢不了战斗。

original: I'll gladly take a taste of what you're making, if you don't mind sharing.
string: 如果你不介意分享，我很乐意尝尝你做的东西。

original: Let's handle the danger before the dough.
string: 先处理危险，再处理面团。

original: I bet the house will be more comfortable after this latest upgrade.
string: 我打赌，房子经过这次升级会更舒适。

original: I bet you'll get good use out of upgrading that staff.
string: 我打赌升级那根法杖会很有用。

original: You work hard. I like that.
string: 你很努力。我喜欢这样。

original: Mmm. You have nice strong arms and a good swing.
string: 嗯。你手臂结实，挥击有力。

original: Watch you don't burn your fingers... or worse.
string: 当心别烧了手指……或者更糟。

original: Keep your wits about you, that looks really hot.
string: 保持清醒，那东西看起来非常烫。

original: A staff has its uses I suppose, but you can't beat Nord steel.
string: 法杖有它的用处，我猜，但比不上诺德钢铁。

original: A fancy mage needs a fancy staff, eh?
string: 讲究的法师需要讲究的法杖，是吧？

original: Building something for your home there?
string: 在为你的家建点什么？

original: Whatever you've got in the oven, it smells decent.
string: 不管你在烤箱里放了什么，闻起来还不错。

original: Baking's not a bad skill I suppose. Better than buying everything.
string: 烘焙不算坏技能，我猜。总比什么都买好。

original: Good swing. A warrior's strike, even against timber.
string: 好挥击。即便是砍木头，也是战士的一击。

original: Careful you don't give yourself a splinter there.
string: 当心别让木刺扎到手。

original: Steady swings. Let the axe do the work.
string: 稳住挥击。让斧头自己发力。

original: We burned kwama shells back home... wood burns cleaner.
string: 我们在家乡烧甲虫壳……木头烧起来更干净。

original: Mind you don't burn yourself on that.
string: 当心别被烫着。

original: Melting down metals is tedious, but worthwhile.
string: 熔炼金属很枯燥，但值得做。

original: Be careful. Burns can be very painful.
string: 当心。烧伤会很疼。

original: A good mage needs a good staff, do your best.
string: 好法师需要好法杖，尽力做好。

original: Making alterations to your home is almost always a worthy pursuit.
string: 改造家园几乎总是值得的追求。

original: A warm loaf does wonders for a cold journey.
string: 一个温热的面包能让寒冷的旅途变得美好。

original: Not much of a fan of staves. But whatever.
string: 不太喜欢法杖。不过随你吧。

original: Whatever you've got in the oven, it doesn't smell half bad.
string: 不管你在烤箱里放了什么，闻起来还不赖。

original: Chopping wood again? Well I suppose someone has to do it.
string: 又在砍木头？嗯，总得有人做。

original: Careful you don't get a splinter there.
string: 当心别扎进木刺。

original: Oh, making furniture for your house? Well, I suppose that's something.
string: 哦，在给房子做家具？嗯，我猜这也算点事。

original: Watch what you're doing. Don't want to burn yourself.
string: 注意你在做什么。可不想你烧伤自己。

original: I'd be careful with that if I were you. It gets very hot.
string: 我要是你就会当心点。那东西会变得很烫。

original: Baking in the middle of a fight? That's... unusual.
string: 战斗中途烤东西？这……真少见。

original: Improving your staff eh? Good choice I suppose.
string: 升级法杖啊？我猜是不错的选择。

original: The smell brings back good memories.
string: 这气味让我想起美好的回忆。

original: Ah. Making your home a bit better is always nice.
string: 啊。让家变得更好一点总是好的。

original: We'll be thankful for this wood on cold nights.
string: 在寒冷的夜晚，我们会感激这些木头。

original: Watch you don't burn yourself on that. It's hot!
string: 当心别烫着自己。很烫！

original: The smell might bring them right to us.
string: 这气味可能会直接把他们引来。

original: Why are you messing with a staff? A good hammer or axe is better than that for smashing heads!
string: 你干嘛鼓捣法杖？一把好锤子或斧头砸脑袋可比那强多了！

original: Be careful with that, it's very hot!
string: 当心那个，非常烫！

original: Orcs don't need fancy houses, just the basics is enough for most of us.
string: 兽人不需要华丽的房子，对我们大多数人来说，基本够用就行。

original: Keep your grip firm, or the axe will take your thumb.
string: 握紧斧柄，否则斧头会砍掉你的拇指。

original: Enchanting yourself a staff eh?
string: 在给自己附魔一根法杖？

original: When you're done enchanting that staff, let's get going.
string: 等你附魔完那根法杖，我们就出发。

original: Improving your house is always a sound investment!
string: 改善房子永远是稳妥的投资！

original: Hey, stick some pies in the oven won't you?
string: 嘿，放几个派进烤箱烤一下吧？

original: Melting down some ingots there?
string: 在熔炼锭块？

original: Working up a bit of a sweat there I see?
string: 我看到你干得有点出汗了？

original: Well well - 'wood' you believe it? Get it? 'Wood?'
string: 哎呀呀——你相信吗？听懂了吗？“Wood”（双关语，wood既是木头，也谐音would）？

original: Be careful there, don't want to burn your hands!
string: 当心点，可不想你烧了手！

original: Oh! You're doing a bit of baking? Can you make me a sweetroll?
string: 哦！你在烤点东西？能给我做个甜卷吗？

original: Watch you don't burn yourself, that's very hot.
string: 当心别烧伤自己，那东西很烫。

original: A good staff will see you right in battle.
string: 一根好法杖能在战斗中助你一臂之力。

original: Making your house a bit better, one small task at a time, eh?
string: 一点一点地把房子变得更好，是吧？

original: Save a piece for me, hmm?
string: 给我留一块，嗯？

original: Baking... so tame. Well at least compared to fighting dragons.
string: 烤东西……真温和。至少比打龙温和多了。

original: Working the smelter is thirsty work. Don't forget to drink something.
string: 操作熔炉很耗体力。别忘了喝点东西。

original: Your swing is strong. I bet the trees fear you.
string: 你挥击有力。我敢说树都怕你。

original: Watch you don't burn yourself on that.
string: 当心别被那东西烫着。

original: Be careful there. I hate the smell of searing flesh.
string: 当心点。我讨厌皮肉烧焦的气味。

original: Who needs a staff like that? Give me a sword or an axe any day!
string: 谁需要那种法杖？给我一把剑或斧头就行！

original: Last time I did that I nearly singed my hair. Watch out.
string: 上次我这么做差点烧到头发。当心点。

original: Be careful not to burn yourself there.
string: 当心别在那里烧伤自己。

original: Good swing. I bet you'd take a head clean off with that.
string: 好挥击。我敢说你用那一下能干脆利落地砍掉脑袋。

original: Oh look at you. Quite domesticated now aren't you?
string: 哦，看看你。现在真够居家的，不是吗？

original: Damn. That smells really good.
string: 该死。闻起来真香。

original: Save me a slice. Don't be stingy.
string: 给我留一片。别小气。

original: Can't fight on an empty belly I suppose.
string: 空着肚子可打不了仗，我猜。

original: That's hard work. Looks like you're doing a decent enough job too.
string: 这活儿不轻松。看起来你干得还算不错。

original: Building something new for your home? Smart.
string: 在为你的家建新东西？明智。

original: That staff upgrade will come in handy in a fight.
string: 升级法杖在战斗中会派上用场。

original: Watch out, don't want to burn yourself on that.
string: 当心，别被那东西烫着。

original: Mind you don't get burned there.
string: 当心别在那里烧伤。

original: I bet that keeps your arms strong, eh?
string: 我打赌这能让你手臂保持强壮，是吧？

original: Smelting stuff is too hot for me. I'll leave that to you.
string: 熔炼东西对我来说太热了。我交给你了。

original: I'll take a piece when it's ready, if you don't mind.
string: 等好了给我一块，如果你不介意的话。

original: If you wanna improve your house, don't let me stop you.
string: 如果你想改善房子，别让我妨碍你。

original: Fiddling with that staff again? Careful - heh! You might go blind!
string: 又在鼓捣那根法杖？当心——嘿！你可能会弄瞎自己！

original: Oh, uh, last time I used one of those, I burnt my - um - unmentionables?
string: 哦，呃，上次我用那东西时，烧到了我的——呃——不方便说的地方？

original: Careful there friend. That looks hot.
string: 当心点，朋友。那东西看起来很烫。

original: Chopping wood is a bit dangerous in my condition. I'll leave that to you shall I?
string: 以我现在的状况砍木头有点危险。我交给你了，好吗？

original: Last time I tried that I nearly chopped off my - uh - never mind.
string: 上次我试那事差点砍掉我的——呃——算了。

original: Nice to watch someone work the smelter. Better than me doing it eh?
string: 看别人操作熔炉挺不错。总比我亲自做要好，是吧？

original: Save me a slice eh? Or... the whole thing?
string: 给我留一片，嗯？或者……整个都给我？

original: Oh that smells good. Can't wait 'til it's ready.
string: 哦，闻起来真好。等不及要尝了。

original: Chopping wood is a bit dangerous in my condition. I'll leave that to you shall I?
string: 以我现在的状况砍木头有点危险。我交给你了，好吗？

original: Yeah, I can see why you'd want to make that.
string: 是啊，我能理解你想做那个。

original: Improving a staff is always a worthwhile task.
string: 升级法杖永远是值得做的事。

original: Oh, good, you're wearing gloves. Better safe than sorry, eh?
string: 哦，好，你戴着手套。安全第一，是吧？

original: Watch your fingers friend. Wouldn't want to get a nasty burn.
string: 当心手指，朋友。可不想你被严重烫伤。

original: Woah that's hot. I can feel the warmth on my face from here.
string: 哇，真烫。我站这儿都能感觉到热气扑脸。

original: You make swinging that axe look easy.
string: 你挥斧头看起来真轻松。

original: Chopping your own wood eh? That sounds a bit like a - uh - never mind.
string: 自己砍木头？听起来有点像——呃——算了。

original: Whatever you've got baking in there, I hope there's enough for me too?
string: 不管你在烤什么，我希望也够我一份？

original: Rather you than me friend. That's far too hot for me.
string: 换我可不行，朋友。那对我来说太烫了。

original: That smells delicious! I hope it's ready soon.
string: 闻起来真香！希望快点好。

original: Spending money on your home is money well spent.
string: 在房子上花钱是花得值。

original: Working on your staff there, I see?
string: 我看到你在弄你的法杖了？

original: Mind you don't burn yourself on that, friend.
string: 当心别被那东西烫着，朋友。

original: Oh, be careful handling that, it's very hot.
string: 哦，当心拿着那东西，很烫。

original: You have a strong swing. I bet you split a man's skull just as easily.
string: 你挥击有力。我敢说你劈开人的头骨也一样轻松。

original: It's always wise to gather wood when you can.
string: 能收集木头时总是明智的。

original: I'll gladly take a slice of that when it's ready.
string: 等好了我很乐意来一片。

original: Mmm! That smells lovely!
string: 嗯！闻起来真棒！

original: Be careful you don't get too close to the smelter. Don't want to lose a hand.
string: 当心别离熔炉太近。可不想你丢掉一只手。

original: Strong swing. You chop wood like Khajiit chops bandits.
string: 好挥击。你砍木头就像虎人砍强盗一样利落。

original: This one thinks that Khajiit should be careful not to burn their fur.
string: 这位觉得虎人该当心别烧了毛皮。

original: Khajiit urges caution - that looks hot.
string: 虎人提醒要当心——那东西很烫。

original: This one recommends care when handling such hot things.
string: 这位建议处理这种烫的东西要小心。

original: Khajiit sees you are making something for your house, yes?
string: 虎人看出你在为房子做东西，是吧？

original: Good firewood means warm paws at night.
string: 好柴火意味着夜晚爪子暖和。

original: This one can see the wisdom in improving that staff.
string: 这位能看出升级那根法杖的智慧。

original: This one would not mind a taste... just a small one.
string: 这位不介意尝一口……就一小口。

original: This one remembers such smells from Elsweyr markets.
string: 这位记得艾斯维尔市场就有这样的气味。

original: This one will stand back. Khajiit does not want his fur singed.
string: 这位会站远点。虎人可不想毛皮被烧焦。

original: The ore turns to liquid fire... beautiful... yet dangerous.
string: 矿石化为液态火焰……美丽……却危险。

original: Keep your grip firm, or the axe will take your thumb.
string: 握紧斧柄，否则斧头会砍掉你的拇指。

original: The rhythm of your swings is satisfying to watch.
string: 你挥击的节奏看着很舒服。

original: Best watch out with that, they get pretty hot.
string: 当心那个，会变得很烫。

original: Hey, be careful not to burn your hands.
string: 嘿，当心别烧了手。

original: Workbench eh? Making anything good? Something for your house?
string: 工作台？做点什么好东西？给你的房子添置？

original: I'm not a fan of that kind of thing. Much prefer crushing heads with something I can swing.
string: 我不喜欢那种东西。我更喜欢用能挥动的家伙砸碎脑袋。

original: I'll take some of that when it's ready. If you don't mind.
string: 等好了我拿一些。如果你不介意的话。

original: Turning ore into something useful. That's pure power.
string: 把矿石变成有用的东西。这才是纯粹的力量。

original: Are you making bread? Oh - I love fresh bread.
string: 你在做面包？哦——我爱新鲜面包。

original: Chopping wood is hard work, but it pays off.
string: 砍木头很辛苦，但值得。

original: You know I spend a lot of time chopping wood, and I have to say, you're pretty good at it.
string: 你知道我花了很多时间砍木头，我得说，你干得相当不错。

original: That wood will come in handy if we need to build a fire.
string: 如果需要生火，这些木头会派上用场。

original: Oh? Improving your home? What a great idea.
string: 哦？改善你的家？真是个好主意。

original: A good staff can be useful... under the right circumstances.
string: 一根好法杖可能有用……在合适的场合。

original: Whatever you're baking, it smells great. Maybe I could get a taste?
string: 不管你在烤什么，闻起来很棒。我能尝一口吗？

original: I never tire of watching rocks being melted into metal.
string: 看石头熔化成金属，我永远看不腻。

original: Watch yourself on that, it looks quite hot.
string: 当心那个，看起来相当烫。

original: I'll just wait out of the way. I can feel the heat on my face even from here.
string: 我就站远点等。光是站这儿脸都感觉热。

original: Better to split skulls than logs, but do as you like.
string: 劈开颅骨比劈木头强，不过随你高兴。

original: I hope you're not expecting me to knead your dough for you.
string: 希望你没指望我帮你揉面团。

original: Do be careful with that. Wouldn't want to burn that delicate skin of yours.
string: 务必当心那个。可不想烧了你那娇嫩的皮肤。

original: Oh, how very domesticated of you. What next? A posh bed with flower petals?
string: 哦，你真够居家的。下一步呢？铺着花瓣的豪华床？

original: You know what they say? Look after your staff and your staff will look after you.
string: 你知道有句话怎么说吗？照顾好你的法杖，法杖就会照顾好你。

original: Yes, by all means, bind unstable energy to a stick. Always ends well.
string: 是啊，当然，请把不稳定的能量绑在木棍上。结果总是很好。

original: If you burn yourself, don't expect me to kiss it better.
string: 如果你烧伤了，别指望我会亲亲帮你止痛。

original: Baking? Hah. And here I thought we were adventurers, not bakers.
string: 在烤东西？哈。我还以为我们是冒险者，不是面包师。

original: Don't forget the secret ingredient to baking - some ground bones.
string: 别忘了烘焙的秘密配料——一些磨碎的骨头。
